module.name: PropertyStorage
module.short: Provides the base class for a storage container use to save and restore control or form properties.

descr.p: propertystorage.pas contains classes and types used to define a storage container for property values: TCustomPropertyStorage. This is a base class and contains abstract virtual methods which must be implemented in a descendent class. For example: TControlPropertyStorage, TFormPropertyStorage, TIniPropStorage, TJSONPropStorage, and TXMLPropStorage.
This file is part of the Lazarus Component Library (LCL).

element.name: TPlacementOperation
element.short: Represents operations performed for a property storage container.

element.name: TPlacementOperation.poSave
element.short: The property is being saved.

element.name: TPlacementOperation.poRestore
element.short: The property is being restored.

element.name: TStoredType
element.short: Alias to the type used to store a property value.

descr.p: When storevariant is defined, TStoredType is aliased to the Variant type. Otherwise, TStoredType is aliased to the AnsiString type.
TStoredType is the type used for the Value property in TStoredValue and in the TStoredValues collection. It is also used to implement the StoredValue property in TCustomPropertyStorage.

element.name: TStoredValueEvent
element.short: Type of an TStoredValue.OnSave and OnRestore notification handler.
element.descr: Called before a property is saved, after a it has been restored.

element.name: TStoredValueEvent.Sender
element.short: Object for the event notification.

element.name: TStoredValueEvent.Value
element.short: Contains the property value for the event.

element.name: TStoredValue
element.short: A key/value pair representing a property value, with added Save/Restore features.

element.name: TStoredValue.GetDisplayName
element.short: Gets the value for the DisplayName property in the collection item.

descr.p: GetDisplayName is overridden in TStoredValue to use the value in the Name property (when assigned). If Name is an empty string (''), the inherited method is called to get the value for the property.

element.name: TStoredValue.GetDisplayName.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TStoredValue.SetDisplayName
element.short: Sets the value for the DisplayName property in the collection item.

descr.p: SetDisplayName is overridden in TStoredValue to set the value for the DisplayName property. SetDisplayName ensures that a new value is not a duplicate of an existing DisplayName value in the TStoredValues. An Exception is raised when AValue is already used in the Collection.
SetDisplayName calls the inherited method prior to exit.

element.name: TStoredValue.SetDisplayName.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TStoredValue.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Create is the overridden constructor for the class instance, and calls the inherited method on entry using ACollection as an argument. Create set the default Value for the collection item to an empty string ('').

element.name: TStoredValue.Create.ACollection
element.short: Collection which owns the collection item.

element.name: TStoredValue.Assign
element.short: Copies property values from the specified persistent object into the current class instance.

descr.p: Assign is an overridden method in TStoredValue used to copy property values from the persistent object specified in Source into the current class instance. When Source is assigned and derived from TStoredValue, the following properties are copied:
No actions are performed in the method when Source is unassigned (Nil) or not derived from TStoredValue. It does not call the inherited method.

element.name: TStoredValue.Assign.Source
element.short: Persistent object with property values copied in the method.

element.name: TStoredValue.Clear
element.short: Clears the content in the Value property.

descr.p: Clear is a method used to remove the existing content in the Value property. The type used for the Value property is dependent on the storevariant compiler define. When defined, the Unassigned variant constant from the RTL is stored in the Value property. Otherwise, an empty string ('') is stored in the property.

element.name: TStoredValue.Save
element.short: Saves the value for the collection item to the storage container for the collection.

descr.p: Save is a method used to save the Value for the collection item to the storage container for the Collection.

Save signals the OnSave event handler (when assigned) to get the actual value for the collection item used in the operation. The value is converted to a String type when the Value property is stored as a Variant type.
The KeyString property contains the key used to XOR-encode the value stored in the method. XOR encoding is not performed when KeyString is an empty string ('').

Save uses the StoredValues collection to access the storage container where the value is written. The WriteString method in the TCustomPropertyStorage container is called to store a key/value pair using the Name for the collection item and its value.
Use Restore to load a collection item value from the storage container for the collection.

element.name: TStoredValue.Restore
element.short: Loads the value for the collection item from the storage container for the collection.

descr.p: Restore is a method used to load the Value for the collection item for the storage container for the collection.
Restore uses the existing Value as the default value for the restore operation. It is converted to a String when Value is defined as a Variant type.

KeyString contains the key used to XOR encode / decode values written to and read from the storage container for the collection. XOR encoding / decoding is not used when KeyString is an empty string ('').
The default value is XOR encoded when needed. The StoredValues collection is used to access the Storage container and calls its ReadString method. The retrieved value is XOR decoded when needed.
Restore signals the OnRestore event handler (when assigned) to validate and/or modify the restored value.

element.name: TStoredValue.StoredValues
element.short: The collection containing the collection item.

descr.p: StoredValues is a read-only TStoredValues property with the collection which owns the collection item.

StoredValues is the TCollection descendant passes as an argument to the Create constructor cast to the TStoredValues type. It provides access to name/value pairs for the collection items, and the Storage container used to read and write collection item values in the Save and Restore methods.

element.name: TStoredValue.Name
element.short: The name for the collection item.

descr.p: Name is a String property with the name for the collection item. It is like the DisplayName property, but enforces uniqueness when setting a new value for the property. An Exception is raised when Name is already used in the Collection.
Name also provides the key used for name/value pairs stored in the storage container for the collection.

element.name: TStoredValue.Value
element.short: The value of the property (as a String or a Variant type).

element.name: TStoredValue.KeyString
element.short: XOR encoding key, empty for encoding is not used.

descr.p: KeyString is a String property which contains the key used to XOR encode/decode the Value for the collection item. XOR encoding is performed in the Save method when the collection item is written to the storage container for the collection. XOR decoding is performed in the Restore method when the value is read from the storage container. XOR encoding/decoding is not performed when KeyString is an empty string ('').

element.name: TStoredValue.OnSave
element.short: Event handler signalled when the collection item value is saved.

descr.p: OnSave is a TStoredValueEvent property with the event handler signalled when the Value for the collection item is saved to the storage container for the collection. Arguments passed to the event handler identify the collection item and the value for the collection item. The Value parameter is a variable argument and can be modified in the event handler as needed.
OnSave is signalled (when assigned) from the Save method, and occurs before the collection item value is XOR encoded (when needed) and written to the storage container for the collection.
Use OnRestore to perform actions needed when the collection item is retrieved from the storage container for the collection.

element.name: TStoredValue.OnRestore
element.short: Event handler signalled when the collection item value is restored.

descr.p: OnRestore is a TStoredValueEvent property with the event handler signalled when the Value for the collection item is restored from the storage container for the collection. Arguments passed to the event handler identify the collection item and the value for the collection item. The Value parameter is a variable argument and can be modified in the event handler as needed.

OnRestore is signalled (when assigned) from the Restore method, and occurs after the collection item value has been retrieved from the collection storage and XOR decoded (when needed). It has not been stored in the Value property when the event handler is signalled.
Use the OnSave event handler to perform actions needed when the Value is saved to the storage container for the collection.

element.name: TStoredValues
element.short: Implements a collection for TStoredValue collection items.

descr.p: TStoredValues is a TOwnedCollection descendant which implements an owned collection for TStoredValue collection items.

TStoredValues provides properties and methods used to access the TStoredValue collection items or their values. Use Items to read and write a collection item by its ordinal position in the collection. Use Values to read and write a collection item by its name. Use StoredValue to read and write the value for a collection item by its name.

The owner of the collection (passed as an argument to the constructor) is a TCustomPropertyStorage instance stored in the Storage property. It provides a container used to read and write name/value pairs which represent the items in the collection. Use RestoreValues and SaveValues methods to read and write the collection items using the Storage container for the collection.

element.name: TStoredValues.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Create is the constructor for the class instance, and calls the inherited constructor using AOwner as the owner for the class instance. When AOwner is derived from TCustomPropertyStorage, it is assigned as the value for the Storage property. TStoredValue is the class type used as the ItemClass for the collection.

element.name: TStoredValues.Create.AOwner
element.short: TCustomPropertyStorage instance which is the owner and the Storage container for the class.

element.name: TStoredValues.IndexOf
element.short: Gets the ordinal position in Items for the collection item with the specified name.

descr.p: IndexOf iterates over the values in the Items property to locate the TStoredValue instance with a Name property that matches the value in AName. AnsiCompareText is called to perform a case-insensitive comparison which also ignores accents in the characters.
The return value contains the ordinal position in Items where the value in AName was located, or -1 when a collection item is not found using the specified name.

element.name: TStoredValues.IndexOf.Result
element.short: Ordinal position for the collection item with the given name, or -1 when not found.

element.name: TStoredValues.IndexOf.AName
element.short: Name of the collection item to locate in the method.

element.name: TStoredValues.SaveValues
element.short: Saves all of the collection items to the Storage container for the collection.

descr.p: SaveValues is a method used to save all of the collection Items to the Storage container for the collection. It iterates over the values in Items and calls the Save method for each of the TStoredValue instances. See TStoredValue.Save for more details.
Use RestoreValues to load the values for the collection items from the Storage container.

element.name: TStoredValues.RestoreValues
element.short: Loads all of the values for the collection Items from the Storage container for the collection.

descr.p: RestoreValues is a method used to load the values in the collection Items from the Storage container for the collection. RestoreValues iterates of the values in Items and calls the Restore method for each of the TStoredValue instances. See TStoredValue.Restore for more details.
Use SaveValues to save the values for all of the collection items to the Storage container for the collection.

element.name: TStoredValues.Storage
element.short: Storage container used to Save and Restore the Values for the collection Items.

descr.p: Storage is a TCustomPropertyStorage property with the storage container used to save and restore the values for the Items in the collection. Storage contains the value passed as the Owner argument to the Create constructor, or Nil when the parameter is not derived from TCustomPropertyStorage.

TCustomPropertyStorage is an ancestor class which contains abstract virtual methods; normally, one of the descendent classes which implement a specific storage mechanism is used as the Owner. For example: TControlPropertyStorage, TFormPropertyStorage, TIniPropStorage, TJSONPropStorage, and TXMLPropStorage.
Storage is used when the SaveValues or RestoreValues method is called. The TStoredValue instances in Items access the property when they call their Save or Restore methods.

element.name: TStoredValues.Items
element.short: Provides indexed access to the TStoredValue collection items by their ordinal position.

descr.p: Items is an indexed TStoredValue property with the items for the collection. It re-implements the internal list to use the TStoredValue type as the ItemClass for the collection.

Values in Items are accessed by their ordinal position in the list of collection items. The Read access specifier ensures that the inherited property value is cast to the TStoredValue type. The Write access specifier ensures that the property value is cast to the TCollectionItem type used in the inherited method.
Items is the default property for the class instance.
Use the Values and StoredValue properties to access a collection item by its name.

element.name: TStoredValues.Items.Index
element.short: Ordinal position for the collection item used as the property value.

element.name: TStoredValues.Values
element.short: Provides indexed access to a TStoredValue instance in the collection by its name.

descr.p: Values is an indexed TStoredValue property which provides access to a collection item with the name specified in the Name argument. The IndexOf method is called to locate the entry in Items matching the specified Name. The property value is Nil if Items does not contain a TStoredValue instance with the value in Name.
When saving a new value for the property, the Assign method in the collection item is called to update the property values for the TStoredValue instance.
Use the StoredValue property to access the String or Variant value for the collection item by its name.

element.name: TStoredValues.Values.Name
element.short: Name for the collection item to retrieve from the Items property.

element.name: TStoredValues.StoredValue
element.short: Provides indexed access to the value for a collection item with the specified name.

descr.p: StoredValue is an indexed TStoredType property which provides access to the value for a collection item with the name specified in the Name argument. TStoredType allows the value to be represented as either a String or Variant type. See TStoredType for more information.

The IndexOf method is called to locate the collection item with the specified Name. If a collection item is not found, the property value can be either an empty string ('') (when TStoredType is AnsiString) or Null (when TStoredType is a Variant).
When writing the value for the indexed property, a new collection item is created in Items if a TStoredValue entry does not already exist with the specified Name.
Use the Values property to access a collection item instance by its Name. Use the Items property to access a collection item by its ordinal position.

element.name: TStoredValues.StoredValue.Name
element.short: Name for the collection item with the property value.

element.name: TPropertyStorageLink
element.short: Links a storage object to a property collection.

descr.p: TPropertyStorageLink is a TPersistent descendant which implements a class used to link a storage container to the collection and values read from and written to the storage. Not very useful by itself, Load/Save depends on installed handlers.

element.name: TPropertyStorageLink.SaveProperties
element.short: Invokes the OnSave handler.

element.name: TPropertyStorageLink.LoadProperties
element.short: Invokes the OnLoad handler.

element.name: TPropertyStorageLink.Destroy
element.short: Destructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Destroy is the overridden destructor for the class instance. It ensures that references used in the OnLoad, OnSave, and Storage properties are set to Nil. Destroy calls the inherited destructor prior to exiting from the method.

element.name: TPropertyStorageLink.Storage
element.short: Contains a reference to the storage contain used in the link.

element.name: TPropertyStorageLink.RootSection
element.short: Path to the root where values are stored in the Storage container.

element.name: TPropertyStorageLink.OnSave
element.short: Event handler signalled when all of the property values are stored.

element.name: TPropertyStorageLink.OnLoad
element.short: Event handler signalled when all of the property values are loaded.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage
element.short: Defines a container used to Save and Restore property values.

descr.p: TCustomPropertyStorage is a TComponent descendant which defines a storage container used to save and restore property values. It has a StoredValues property that is a collection with items containing the Names and Values read and written using the storage container.

TCustomPropertyStorage is a base class; it includes abstract virtual methods which must be implemented in a descendant to use a particular storage medium or format. For example: TControlPropertyStorage, TFormPropertyStorage, TIniPropStorage, TJSONPropStorage, and TXMLPropStorage.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.FLinks
element.short: The list of linked property collections.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.FSaved
element.short: True when everything has been saved.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.FRestored
element.short: True when everything has been restored.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.AddLink
element.short: Establishes a connection to a property collection.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.RemoveLink
element.short: Drops the connection to a property collection.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.NotifyLinks
element.short: Notifies all connected property collections.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.GetRoot
element.short: Gets the value for the Root property.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.GetRoot.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.RootSection
element.short: Gets the path needed to represent the section for the Root (Owner) component.

descr.p: RootSection is a String function which builds the path in the storage container where the property values are located.

RootSection uses the value in the Root property to determine the return value for the method. When Root is assigned and derived from TComponent, its Name or ClassName property is prepended to the return value. Preference is given to the value in its Name property.
Preceding Owner components are also examined and prepended to the return value. The value is complete when an Owner does not exist, or is not derived from TComponent.

The return value represents the component hierarchy used to access the property values in the storage container. The value is used in the SaveProperties and RestoreProperties methods to load property values from the underlying storage mechanism.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.RootSection.Result
element.short: The Name or ClassName prefix for the Owner component, or an empty string when Root is not assigned.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.SaveProperties
element.short: Saves values for properties in the container collection to the storage mechanism.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.RestoreProperties
element.short: Restores property values from the storage mechanism to the container collection items.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.GetPropertyList
element.short: Builds a list with the properties defined in the container collection.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.FinishPropertyList
element.short: set Objects (i.e. the component of each property).
element.descr: Reads the Strings[] in the list, retrieves and stores the associated Root or Component object in Objects[].

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.DoReadInteger
element.short: Reads an integer value, stored as a string.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.DoReadString
element.short: Default OnReadString handler; must be overridden.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.DoReadString.Result
element.short: The previously stored string.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.DoReadString.DefaultValue
element.short: The default value, when no string was stored.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.DoWriteString
element.short: Default OnWriteString handler; must be overridden.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.DoWriteString.Section
element.short: The name of the section.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.DoWriteString.Ident
element.short: The name (key) of the property.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.DoWriteString.Value
element.short: The value string to store.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.DoWriteInteger
element.short: Writes an Integer value as a String.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Create is the overridden constructor for the class instance, and calls the inherited method on entry. Create allocates resources needed for member variables in the class instance, and sets the default value for the Active property to True.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.Create.AOwner
element.short: Owner of the class instance.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.Destroy
element.short: Destructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Destroy is the overridden destructor for the class instance. It calls the FreeStorage method to free any items in the collection, and frees the TStoredValues instance in the StoredValues property. TPropertyStorageLink instances in the internal list are freed, and the list itself is also freed. Destroy calls the inherited method prior to exit.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.Save
element.short: Saves all linked property collections.

descr.p: Uses SaveProperties and StoredValues.SaveValues to do the actual work. At least one of these should be implemented.
All linked property collections are notified when everything has been stored, or to actually store their values.
The OnSavingProperties handler is invoked before the properties are stored, OnSaveProperties afterwards.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.Restore
element.short: Restores all linked property collections.

descr.p: Uses RestoreProperties and StoredValues.RestoreValues to do the actual work. At least one of these should be implemented.
All linked property collections are notified, when everything has been restored, or to actually restore the values.
The OnRestoringProperties handler is invoked before the properties are restored, OnRestoreProperties afterwards.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.StorageNeeded
element.short: Ensures that the storage mechanism for the container is available.

descr.p: StorageNeeded is a method used to ensure that the underlying storage mechanism for the container has been allocated and configured. StorageNeeded has an empty implementation in TCustomPropertyStorage. It must be overridden in a descendent class to use the format and access mechanism needed.
The ReadOnly argument indicates whether write access is enabled for the storage. In general, the Save method requires write access and the Restore method does not.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.FreeStorage
element.short: Frees resources allocated for the underlying storage mechanism.

descr.p: FreeStorage is a method used to free resources allocated for the underlying storage mechanism for the container in StorageNeeded. FreeStorage has an empty implementation in TCustomPropertyStorage, and must be overridden in a descendent class.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.ReadBoolean
element.short: Reads an Boolean value, stored as a string.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.ReadBoolean.Result
element.short: Value read in the method.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.ReadBoolean.Ident
element.short: Identifier for the value read in the method.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.ReadBoolean.DefaultValue
element.short: Default value used when the specified identifier is not found.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.ReadString
element.short: Reads an String value from the RootSection.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.ReadString.Result
element.short: String value read in the method.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.ReadString.Ident
element.short: Identifier for the value read in the method.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.ReadString.DefaultValue
element.short: Default value used when the specified identifier is not found.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.ReadInteger
element.short: Reads an integer value, stored as a string, from the RootSection.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.ReadInteger.Result
element.short: Value read in the method.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.ReadInteger.Ident
element.short: Identifier for the value read in the method.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.ReadInteger.DefaultValue
element.short: Default value used when the identifier is not found.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.ReadRect
element.short: Reads an TRect instance stored as a String value.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.ReadRect.Ident
element.short: Identifier for the value read in the method.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.ReadRect.ARect
element.short: TRect instance where the value is stored.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.ReadRect.Default
element.short: Default value used when the specified identifier is not found.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.ReadStrings
element.short: Reads a list of strings, stored with a Count value.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.ReadStrings.Ident
element.short: The name of the list property.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.ReadStrings.List
element.short: The list to which the strings are added.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.ReadStrings.DefaultList
element.short: A list of default values, used when nothing was stored yet.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.WriteString
element.short: Writes a String to the RootSection.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.WriteString.Ident
element.short: Identifier for the value.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.WriteString.Value
element.short: String value written in the method.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.WriteInteger
element.short: Writes an integer into the RootSection.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.WriteInteger.Ident
element.short: Identifier for the value.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.WriteInteger.Value
element.short: Integer value written in the method.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.WriteBoolean
element.short: Writes a Boolean value to the RootSection.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.WriteBoolean.Ident
element.short: Identifier for the value.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.WriteBoolean.Value
element.short: Boolean value written in the method.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.WriteRect
element.short: Writes an TRect instance to the RootSection.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.WriteRect.Ident
element.short: Identifier used for the rectangle values.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.WriteRect.Value
element.short: TRect instance written in the method.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.WriteStrings
element.short: Writes a list of strings into the RootSection.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.WriteStrings.Ident
element.short: Identifier used for the string values.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.WriteStrings.List
element.short: TStrings instance with the values written in the method.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.EraseSections
element.short: Removes all sections that are descendants of the specified root section.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.StoredValue
element.short: Provides indexed access to the value for a collection item by its name.

descr.p: StoredValue is an indexed TStoredType property which provides indexed access to the value for a collection item by the name specified in AName. Read and write access is redirected to the StoredValue property in the StoredValues collection.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.StoredValue.AName
element.short: Name of the collection item with the value for the property.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.Root
element.short: Path where values in the storage container are rooted.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.Active
element.short: Indicates whether the container is Active and allows access to its storage.

descr.p: Active is a Boolean property which indicates if the container can access its underlying storage mechanism. In TCustomPropertyStorage, the default value for the property is True.
Active is used in the Save and Restore methods, and controls whether the corresponding actions can be performed using the collection items and storage for the container.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.StoredValues
element.short: Collection with the names and values for properties handled for the container.

descr.p: StoredValues is a TStoredValues property with the collection of names and values for properties handled by the storage container. StoredValues is used in the Save and Restore methods when the collection items are read or written using the underlying storage mechamism for the container. It is also used to read or write the value for the indexed StoreValue property.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.OnSavingProperties
element.short: Event handler signalled when the Save method is started.

descr.p: OnSavingProperties is a TNotifyEvent property with the event handler signalled when the Save method is started. It is signalled (when assigned) after the StorageNeeded method has been called, and before collection values in StoredValues are written using SaveProperties.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.OnSaveProperties
element.short: Event handler signalled when the Save method is completed.

descr.p: OnSaveProperties is a TNotifyEvent property with the event handler signalled when the Save method is completed. It is signalled (when assigned) after the OnSavingProperties event handler. Values for collection items in StoredValues have already been written using SaveProperties when the event handler is called.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.OnRestoringProperties
element.short: Event handler signalled when the Restore method is started.

descr.p: OnRestoringProperties is a TNotifyEvent property with the event handler signalled when the Restore method is started. It is signalled (when assigned) after the StorageNeeded method has been called , and before values for the collection items are read and applied using StoredValues and RestoreProperties.

element.name: TCustomPropertyStorage.OnRestoreProperties
element.short: Event handler signalled when the Restore method is completed.

descr.p: OnRestoreProperties is a TNotifyEvent property with the event handler signalled when the Restore method is completed. OnRestoreProperties is signalled (when assigned) after the OnRestoringProperties event handler has been signalled, after property values have been read using RestoreProperties, and after the values have been loaded in the StoredValues collection.
